mouseOverData.text: The location and printer of the 36-line Biblia latina is uncertain. ISTC note: "[Bamberg: Printer of the 36-line Bible, not after 1461] [Mainz: n.pr., before 1460]. The date of rubrication 1461 is found on a single leaf, Paris BN (DeR(M) 23,13), formerly the last leaf of the Wolfenbüttel HAB copy. For arguments favouring Gutenberg as printer see G.D. Painter, Gutenberg and the B36 group. A re-consideration, in Essays in honour of Victor Scholderer (1970) p.292-322. Polain assigns to Mainz, before 1460." Because of this discrepancy, the next known Bamberg printing, Ackermann von Böhmen of 1463, is also listed.

Dated by BSB-Ink. See also V. Scholderer in The Library 5th ser. 3 (1949) pp. 50-54 (reprinted in 50 Essays (Amsterdam, 1966) pp.192ff). Dated not before 1470 by G. Piccard , in AGB 8 (1967) coll.25-322.
Proctor and BMC originally assigned to Augsburg. Cf. however GfT 1323 and 1324

location.printer: Heinrich Bechtermüntze, Nicolaus Bechtermüntze and Wigandus Spyes of Orthenberg
Johann Neumeister and Aemilianus de Orfinis

firstWork.title: De bello Italico adversus Gothos gesto
firstWork.author: Brunus Aretinus, Leonardus

mouseOverData.text: Majority of sources cite 1454-1455. ISTC note: Sheets were seen by Aeneas Sylvius Piccolomini some time before his letter of 12 Mar. 1455 (E. Meuthen in Gb Jb 1982, pp.108-18). Aeneas's letter is printed in the edition of ther Hoernen about 1480, Voull(K) 967 (M. Davies in The Library, 18 (1996), 193-201, with plate). Copies at München BSB and Vienna ÖNB have a printed rubrication guide in four leaves

firstWork.title: Libellus de ultimis syllabis et Centimetrum. With additions by Laurentius Abstemius, ed
firstWork.author: Servius Maurus, Honoratus

mouseOverData.text: Imprint reads 12 Jan. 1488, but BMC states there may have been an extra "X" printed on imprint, making actual date 1478. (BMC Vol. VII, p. lxxxvi). ISTC note: 12 Jan. '1488'. [i.e. 1478?]. Proctor and BMC (VII p.lxxxvi) argued from the type and general appearance that the 1488 date must be a misprint. Attilio Carosi, Librai cartai e tipografi in Viterbo ... nei secoli XV e XVI (Viterbo, 1988), pp.23-27, argues for the date as printed.

Zinna is not listed in the ISTC record.
On the identity of the printer, see Geldner I p.268 and Hühns.
ISTC dates this as "not after 1496." The Bodleian copy has a purchase date of 1496; Polain dates about 1494-96.
ISTC lists the date as before September 8, 1496. Latitude and longitude is for Il Barco region of Italy.

firstWork.author: Johannes Fabri and Schram, Johannes

mouseOverData.text:
ISTC states that GW identifies the author as Johannes Fabri.
The ISTC number for the Quaestio fabulosa is is00324000.

firstWork.title: Ausschreiben gegen den Missbrauch des Namens Gottes. Worms, 7 Aug. 1495
firstWork.author: Maximilian I, Imperator

mouseOverData.text:
Another ISTC number for this book is im00383213.
ISTC dates this as after February 1, 1497. GW(Einbl) assigned to Bumgart, F. Schanze, in 'Erstdruck' S. 127, assigns to Köbel
The edict, dated 7 Aug. 1495 in the text, was not approved until 1 Feb. 1497 at the Reichstag in Lindau (F. Schanze in Gb Jb 1999, pp. 124-25). Assigned to Bumgart in GW (Einbl), Schanze, p. 127 assigns to Köbel.
There is also the De primis erudimentis linguae latinae by Hercules Florus that was also printed by Rosembach in 1500. The ISTC number is if00230600.

firstWork.title: Le débat de Cuidier et de Fortune
firstWork.author: La Marche, Olivier de

mouseOverData.text: ISTC dates this between 1493 and 1500.

firstWork.title: De duobus amantibus Guiscardo et Sigismunda
firstWork.author: Brunus Aretinus, Leonardus

mouseOverData.text: On the location of this printing-house in Poland see E. Szandorowska, in Quaerendo 2 (1972), pp.162-72. The press was previously assigned to the Netherlands (GW) and tentatively to Cologne (V. Scholderer, in BSA 54 (1960) pp.111-13; reprinted in Fifty Essays (Amsterdam, 1966) pp.279-80) A translation by Leonardus Brunus Aretinus of Boccaccio, Decameron IV.1

firstWork.title: De officiis. Add: Paradoxa Stoicorum; Laelius, sive de amicitia; Cato maior, sive de senectute
firstWork.author: Cicero, Marcus Tullius

mouseOverData.text: The colophon date is perhaps copied from that of the Pinerolo edition of Juvenalis (Goff J643), or vice versa. Format is f°, not 4°, as GW (Sheppard, CIBN)
Woodcuts. On the place of printing, see F. Geldner in Gb Jb 1944/49 p.101
London, British Library (IB.56904, Imperfect, wanting the last 5 leaves, which are supplied by photographs. Ff.1-17 are misbound)

firstWork.title: Indulgentia 1488 [Latin]. For the benefit of the Cathedral at Orense
firstWork.author: Innocentius VIII, Pont. Max.

mouseOverData.text: On the place of printing and the date, cf. Norton(1966) pp.31-32. Haebler dated about 1490

On the printer, see P. Veneziani, in La Bibliofilia 80 (1978) pp.62-67 & fig.2. GW assigned to de Bolonya, and IGI to Valencia. A local law code written in 'lingua sardisca' (L. Balsamo, La stampa in Sardegna (1968) p.15)
On the date, often previously recorded as 1503, see A.K. Offenberg, in A choice of corals (Nieuwkoop, 1992) pp. 102-32
